newsitem.title: USA: PP&L sees Susquehanna 1 nuke restart Weds.
newsitem.headline: PP&L sees Susquehanna 1 nuke restart Weds.

text.p: Pennsylvania Power and Light Co (PP&L) said Tuesday it planned to restart the 1,090 megawatt (MW) Susquehanna 1 nuclear unit Wednesday after being shut last month for repairs.
"It looks like tomorrow," said a PP&L spokeswoman, when asked about Susquehanna 1's startup.
Engineers are still correcting a problem with the unit's turbine bypass valves, she added.
The adjoining unit 2, at 1,094 MW, is ramping down for its refueling outage which is set to begin March 15.
Th two Susquehanna units in Delta, Pa., are jointly owned by PP&L and Allegheny Electric Cooperative Inc.
The Susquehanna facility accounts for 30 percent of PP&L's power deliveries and 20 percent of its installed generation capacity.
